site.projectname.lang

Interface Syntax

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NICSyntax

    public interface Syntax
    Syntax definition for a given language or dataset, used heavily by SyntaxErrorException

    Standards for implementation extend beyond a normal interface:

    • Must be implemented by an Enum
    • Should contain an enum with no parameters, used for passing enum as a static class (to SyntaxErrorException)
    • Enum values should contain a regular expression defining the token
    • Enum values should contain a semantic representation of the token, for error output

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      boolean contains(java.lang.String s)
      Checks if the syntax contains a given regular expression

      Checks for Syntax-Specific errors.

      Returns the short name of the token, i.e.
      java.lang.String getPossibles(java.lang.String s)
      Creates a set of possible solutions to an error
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the token.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the token. This should be the regular expression
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Regular Expression of the token

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the short name of the token, i.e. HEX5 vs. 5-bit Hexidecimal value
        Returns:
        Short name of token

      • getPossibles

        java.lang.String getPossibles(java.lang.String s)
        Creates a set of possible solutions to an error

        For example: Input: (REG)|(HEX5|IMM5) (After evaluation to regular expression) Output: Register or 5-bit Immediate value

      • contains

        boolean contains(java.lang.String s)
        Checks if the syntax contains a given regular expression
        Returns:
        Syntax contains regular expression

      • errorCheck

        java.lang.String errorCheck(java.lang.String line,
                            java.lang.String message)
        Checks for Syntax-Specific errors.

        For example NICSyntax uses errorCheck to ensure tokens are comma-seperated, as SyntaxErrorException disregards commas as of writing

        Returns:
        Error Message regarding syntax-specific errors
